column4: Another stupid question due to some tinkering I accidentally removed the wireless network monitor from the bar, and I can't find it in the add to panel section
huh ?
pkill gnome-panel ... should reset it ... it technically supposed to be there
sorry I have no idea what you even mean by pkill, I've been on ubuntu for a maximum of 20 minutes, but eventually I'll figure it out
open a terminal .. Applications>Accessories>Terminal ... type ... pkill gnome-panel >enter
k
:S Nothing
give me a few minutes and I will see if I can help you get it working again .. please put my name at the beginning when speaking with me
Goto System>Administration>Network, .. see what we get there
^^^^ duoh
cool will do.  No worries or anything I typically learn by screwing things up and having to fix them  lol
and sometimes we have to break something to get it to work ... so if necessarry you may want to come here and ask questions, or discribe what is going on so that we may better assist you
there is no "network" only network tools.
Shows devices, traceroute, portscan ect
run sudo network-admin ... in your terminal
command not found, ( I tried twice, I found this on ubuntu forums worth trying - http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=241889
My bad I already looked in the add panel section for network monitor
I have it fixed
I hope
good good
It at least shows signal strength I'll see if I can manage connections XD
Thanks.
